p: Forebrain lesions were consistently present (90%). About 50% had additional lesions in thalamus and brainstem. Interestingly, cerebellum was involved in 30%. Without brain biopsy, 3 dogs with a focal lesion and normal CSF would have been more suspicious for neoplasia than for encephalitis.
